explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2004).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available - melting point: 53degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 2,512mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 2,512mg/kg (NICNAS (2000)) and 2,515mg/kg (DFGOT vol. 4 (1992)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Because the rat LC50 (4-hour inhalation) value of 5.07mg/L (equivalent to 845ppm) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.76 (2005)) was higher than 110% of the saturated vapour concentration (790ppm, 20degC), the substance was considered as "dust exposure containing vapour" and was classified based on the dust classification.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (4-hour application) performed in accordance with OECD Guidelines (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.76 (2005)): Mildly irritating.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests performed in accordance with OECD Guidelines (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.76 (2005)): Redness and edema of the conjunctiva are observed in one out of three specimens, both of which disappear after 72 hours of exposure; mild eye irritation is observed, with no effects on the iris and cornea. The substance is considered "mildly irritating" to the eyes.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: based on the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.76 (2005) - Nine out of 24 specimens (Score: 1), four out of 24 specimens (Score: 2) and one out of 24 specimens (Score: 3) (all scored based on the maximization method). The substance is considered to cause skin sensitization.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the negative data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests), the absence of data on germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo, described in EU-RAR No.48 (2004) and IARC 73 (1999).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A3 by ACGIH (2005), Category R by NTP (2005), Category 3 by EU (2004) and 2B by IARC (1999).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the description in the report on two-generation reproductive toxicity tests (oral route) (EU-RAR No.48 (2004), CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.76 (2005)): A decrease in the number and body weight of alive newborns is observed at dosing levels not toxic to parental animals.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "hypochromia, microcytic anemia, methemoglobinuria" (CERI Hazard Data 96-47 (1998)), "jaundice, hemolytic anemia, methemoglobinuria" (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.76 (2005).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory organs, liver, nervous system) Category 2 (kidneys)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "pulmonary granulomatosis, hepatic atrophy/cirrhosis, ataxia, speech disorder, tremor in the fingers, an increase of muscular reflexes" (CERI Hazard Data 96-47 (1998)) and the evidence from animal studies including "pulmonary interstitial edema, congestion, alveolar hemorrhage, cloudy swelling in the liver, focal necrosis, cirrhosis, an increase in the kidney weight, hyaline droplet accumulation in the renal tubular epithelium" (CERI Hazard Data 96-47 (1998)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.7mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2005) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (28 days decomposition (the OECD testing guideline 301D): 67% (EU-RAR, 2004)), and bio-accumulation was low (BCF=190 (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Not classified.
